docs.lead_paragraph: What's the thing that we in the news media are worst at covering?

headline.main: What Are We Worst at Covering?

docs.abstract: What's the thing that we in the news media are worst at covering? I would argue that it's public health. One problem is that we tend to cover things that happen on a particular day, and public health challenges usually unfold every day - so they're never really considered news. Conversely, we're at our best [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: I've written before about the fact that layoffs haven't been the economy's main problem in recent years, or even in this recession. Layoffs were, in fact, relatively uncommon during the past decade. The layoff rate was lower in the 2000s than it was in the late 1990s boom.
docs.abstract: Why is it that the United States economy has created so few jobs over the past decade?
docs.snippet: Why is it that the United States economy has created so few jobs over the past decade?
